english: to give; to; for; to supply

etymology.description: semantic: 糸 + phonetic: 合; simplified: 糸 → 纟
etymology.interpretation: The silk component points to textiles, valuables, or the notion of provisioning, while 合 provides the sound and a sense of joining or bringing together. The original sense related to abundance or supply naturally extended to giving or providing something to someone.
etymology.simplification: The left-side silk component 糸 was simplified to 纟, part of a systematic reduction of the silk radical series in Simplified Chinese; the phonetic 合 was retained.

examples.chinese: 请给我一杯水(請給我一杯水)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ yì bēi shuǐ.
examples.english: Please give me a glass of water.

examples.chinese: 这封信是给老师的(這封信是給老師的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fēng xìn shì gěi lǎoshī de.
examples.english: This letter is for the teacher.

examples.chinese: 我给你发了一封邮件(我給你發了一封郵件)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gěi nǐ fā le yì fēng yóujiàn.
